CatDescriptText: J.J. Gardner, clerk, East Carnegie and John Frank, clerk, South Side, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, November 25, 1961, pg. 7  with question: "Do you think Negroes should hold high political offices, particularly those which have payrolls attached?" J.J. Gardner's answer reads: "Why not?  I don't see why they shouldn't."  John Frank's answer reads: "If they have the ability it will be all right."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of J.J. Gardner wearing fedora, eyeglasses, diagonally striped tie, and light colored overcoat, standing in front of ribbed metal wall, Downtown; Portrait of John Frank wearing dark fedora, diagonally striped tie, and tweed overcoat, standing in front of ribbed metal wall, Downtown
